quest.name: Lyse Takes the Lead
journal: Lyse is eager to leave Castrum Oriens.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: If anyone can determine the fate of Shinryu and Omega, it's Master Garlond. For now, let us remain focused on our current mission.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Were Omega not a threat to us all, its effectiveness in subduing draconic foes would seem almost admirable. But such weapons are doomed to be misused. Let us pray we never have need of its services again.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: I do hope you're not thinking about running off to help Master Garlond. It is not your duty to solve all of the world's problems, you know!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The bridge over the Velodyna River has always held great strategic importance, hence the Garleans' decision to transform it into a fortified installation. Needless to say, we will not be crossing there.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: As you've probably heard, there are plenty of factions in the Resistance, so I'm taking us to see the one with the most influence.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Their headquarters are located in a place called Rhalgr's Reach─an old temple, to the east of here, across the Velodyna River.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I learned a route that should allow us to avoid imperial patrols. Stick with me and we'll be there before you know it!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: It's so quiet. Almost as though the imperials haven't been here for some time...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: On your guard. The imperials know these lands better than we.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: At the risk of upsetting the cartographic fraternity, I can't help observing that “East End” depends entirely on one's perspective. I mean, people don't even think of it as Gridania anymore, do they?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: They call it East End because it marks the end of the Black Shroud. Note the sparser vegetation.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Still with me? Good. From here, we'll head northeast towards the river. The water's not too deep, so we won't have to swim.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text:
Heh heh... See, Brother? Nothing to worry about.
...Though no one would blame you for donning your buoyancy aids, just in case.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: We should not linger out here in the open.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Y'shtola's right. We need to cross before the imperials spot us.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: At a glance, it certainly seems shallow enough...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I don't see any soldiers. Good. Let's cross.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: You're wondering about the tower to the south?

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: It's part of Castellum Velodyna. That's what the imperials decided to call the old bridge after they fortified it.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I call it a great big eyesore. Honestly, you can see that rotten banner from absolutely malms away. <sigh> They never miss a chance to rub our noses in it, do they... Come on, we should keep moving.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Are we there yet?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Lyse did well. It is...reassuring.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: And we didn't run afoul of even a single patrol! What a pleasant surprise─in that there were no surprises.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: So, the Reach lies beyond? But I do not see a path...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: We're here. On the other side of this pass is Rhalgr's Reach.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: So you say, but all I see are rocks. I presume there is some sort of trick to this?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: ...Indeed. A glamour.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Good eye, Y'shtola!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I take it they have a talented mage in their ranks─or mayhap an artificer trained in the modification of glamour prisms...?

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Something like that. The important thing is that it fools the Garleans.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Oh, before we go in─I don't know if Tataru told you, but my friend Naago, the messenger who came to the Rising Stones, is a member of this faction.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: So they know us, and they shouldn't attack us on sight. That said, they can be a bit jumpy, so let me lead the way, and, uh...don't go reaching for your weapons or anything.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: And with a sprinkle of demasking dust, all is laid bare!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Seeing it now, I feel rather foolish for not having deduced it earlier.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: All clear! Let's go, let's go!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Impressive or no, twenty years is a long time for even so complex a glamour to escape the Empire's notice...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I suppose you could disguise almost anything with a glamour prism, if you really wanted to. Have you ever used one? Why am I asking─of course you haven't.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Let us pray that they are amenable to our proposal. United, we stand to accomplish so much more...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: It's hard to feel at ease with that giant statue looking down on you...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Fascinating... A massive, nigh-imperceptible glamour encompassing the entire valley... I see now how the settlement was able to escape the watchful eyes of imperial airships.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Ordinarily, I'd shudder at the thought of armed rebels trampling about in an ancient temple of immense historical importance─but Rhalgr is the breaker of worlds, so it seems rather appropriate, if anything.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: This temple was once home to the Fist of Rhalgr, as I recall. Yes...there is no mistaking that statue.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: It's good to see Naago up and moving again. I wasn't there when she headed home, so I naturally assumed she'd left too soon. Always overdoing it, that one.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: A pleasure to see you again─and Krile and Y'shtola, without whose help I might not be standing here today. At least, not so soon.

dialogue.name: MEFFRID
dialogue.text: Ho, so you really came. I never thought I'd see you here, but I'm glad. I'm glad...

dialogue.name: CONRAD
dialogue.text: You'll forgive us our precautions, but we couldn't be sure who had crossed the barrier. We see you now for who you are, though─the Scions of the Seventh Dawn.

obj.n: The Promise of a New Beginning
